title: Fort Gibson woman died from gunshot wound
content:
An alleged accidental shooting occurred in Muskogee County at about 8:30 p.m. Wednesday resulting in a death, said Orvil Loge, Muskogee County district attorney.
Jady Abbott, 33, of Fort Gibson was buckled up and sitting in the front seat of a vehicle at her home in Fort Gibson off Two Mile Road, Loge said. Joseph Lane, her boyfriend, was loading a high-powered rifle in the back seat when it went off, killing Abbott, said Sheriff-elect Rob Frazier.
Frazier is on payroll assisting the sheriff’s office until he takes office as sheriff on Jan. 3.
Lane spoke with the lead investigator and was cooperative. Lane was upset, and on more than one occasion had to “get his composure back,” Frazier said. Lane was released under his own recognizance.
Abbott was pronounced dead at the scene, Frazier said. Abbott’s body was taken to the Oklahoma Medical Examiner’s Office in Tulsa on Thursday morning, said Deputy Sheriff Faye Banks, who is investigating the shooting.
